text:
After selecting "Minimum" installation, Service component NOT selected (becuase 
it's a Win98 system) I got the following error:

Failed to install Tomcat5 service
Check your settings and permissions
[Abort] [Retry] [Ignore]

The permissions can't be a problem because it's a Win98 system.

In the Tomcat strart group there is apparently no icon to start/stop Tomcat, no 
icon in the tray.
creator: cris@dimensionex.net

text:
I don't know if Win9x is still supported at all in the .exe wrapper (and,
therefore, the Windows installer). Apparently not, try using the shell scripts
instead.

I don't know if developers have Win9x development machines anymore, so you may
be on your own. I am not aware of anyone testing recent Tomcat versions on Win9x
either.
creator: remm@apache.org
yoavs@computer.org
text: Yeah, Win9x is not supported with that installer.

creator: randyzapata@hotmail.com
text:
I am running into the same problwm on my Windows 2003 server when the progess 
bar is at .../java/jre/bin/client/jvm.dll 
Failed to install Tomcat5 service
Check your settings and permissions
[Abort] [Retry] [Ignore]

I have uninistalled my Java 1.5 update 3 and installed Java 1.5 update 4 and I 
change the JAVA folder permissions to full control for everybody.

Just tested, and it works fine for me on Windows 2003 server, using both JDK
1.4.2 and J2SE 5.0 (update 4), Tomcat 5.5.10.

You need to ensure proper write permissions on $CATALINA_HOME and below, not on
$JAVA_HOME and below.  (Of course, the $JAVA_HOME tree should have at least read
permissions for the user installing Tomcat).
creator: yoavs@computer.org
